body.value: Psychotria is a large genus within the Rubiaceae family (coffee family), including about 1,500 plant species, many of which have bioactive components including naphthoquinones, peptides, benzoquinones, pigments, and alkaloids. This genus is particularly diverse in the Atlantic (South American) forest and Indigenous people have identified the properties of several psychotria species. For example, P. ipecacuanha has expectorant and emetic properties and P. colorata has been used as a painkiller.
